Description: Wyoming Refining Co. agreed to pay a civil penalty of $150,000 and spend approximately $14 million in upgrades to resolve alleged Clean Air Act violations at its Newcastle, Wyo., refinery.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division

Description: Wyoming Refining agreed to pay a $280,800 penalty and fund $93,600 in supplementary environmental projects in settlement of allegations it was violating ammonia effluent limits at its facility, and operational changes to achieve permit compliance had not yet been completed.
Notes: Penalty includes a $93,600 supplemental environmental project
Penalty includes a $13,376 supplemental environmental project

Info Source: Extracted from a download of the EPA's Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) ICIS FE&C file downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at http://echo.epa.gov/tools/data-downloads#downloads
Notes: Note: This penalty is a duplicate of an amount shown in another record (either because it applies to a multi-location settlement or because Violation Tracker contains an agency record and a settlement announcement for the same case).
